description:
**Who you are:** 

 You like software that feels calm. In school, clubs, or an internship, you shipped things people used‚Äîand you learned that the best releases are the ones where everything that could break already broke in
 
**dev/UAT** 

 (on purpose).
 




  





 You also know some truths only show up under
 **real traffic** 

 , so you ship behind flags, watch the graphs, and make the next release calmer. You never say ‚Äúit works on my laptop,‚Äù because your laptop
 
**mimics prod** 

 : containers, seeded fixtures, contract tests, and mocks for the sharp edges.
 





 We‚Äôre building a
 
**WealthTech app** 

 with
 
**assisted trading** 

 (advisors in the loop), a clean
 
**360¬∞ portfolio** 

 view, and ideas users act on. It has to be fast, stable, and simple‚Äîbecause real clients and advisors rely on it.
 




  





**Mission:** 

 Ship
 
**simple, dependable** 

 features end‚Äëto‚Äëend‚Äîwith guidance‚Äî
 
**types first, tests included, infra‚Äëaware** 

 .
 




**What you‚Äôll do (one line!)** 

 Build small features that make real users‚Äô days easier, write the tests, and learn to operate what you ship. You will be guided by Principle Engineers \\- so don‚Äôt sweat \\- you will have help!
 




  





**What you‚Äôll do** 



* Build product surfaces in
 
**React/Next.js \\+ TypeScript** 

 ; pair to wire APIs to
 
**Node.js/Express/Nest** 

 .
* Keep contracts honest with
 
**TypeScript \\+ Zod/JSON Schema** 

 ; write
 
**unit/integration/e2e** 

 tests that run in CI (RTL/Jest/Vitest/Playwright).
* Add
 
**feature flags** 

 , basic
 
**telemetry** 

 (events, logs), and
 
**tracing** 

 to see what happens after release.
* Use
 
**Docker dev containers** 

 , seeded fixtures,
 
**MSW mocks** 

 , and
 
**Storybook** 

 so local ‚âà prod; keep PRs small and focused.
* After release: read dashboards, fix papercuts, tighten copy/flows‚Äîthe
 
**closed loop** 

 ‚Äîand write short notes.
* Use
 
**Cursor/Copilot** 

 to scaffold code, tests, and docs‚Äîthen
 
**review and explain** 

 every change.
* Work
 
**async‚Äëfirst** 

 : plan your time, ask for help early, communicate clearly in Slack/Docs.



  





**How we build (principles)** 



* **Keep it small.** 

 Small PRs, small blast radius.
* **Types earn trust.** 

 Make invalid states unrepresentable.
* **Tests tell stories.** 

 Happy path \\+ edges; guardrails in CI.
* **Prod reveals truth‚Äîsafely.** 

 Flags, canaries, synthetic load; fast rollbacks.
* **Parity over excuses.** 

 No ‚Äúworks on my laptop‚Äù‚Äîcontainers, seeded data, contract tests, mocks.
* **UAT isn't a ceremony.** 

 Masked prod‚Äëlike data; idempotent migrations and backfills run there first.
* **GenAI is a power tool,** 

 not a crutch. We review, we measure.
* **Infra is part of the job.** 

 Observability over optimism; boring deploys beat heroic fixes.
* **Jargon‚Äëlight, clarity‚Äëheavy.** 

 Plain words beat buzzwords.



  





**What you bring** 



* **New grad or 0‚Äì2 years** 

 experience (internships welcome).
* Comfortable with
 
**JavaScript/TypeScript** 

 ,
 
**React** 

 basics, and a backend intro (
 
**Node.js** 

 ).
* Basics in
 
**Git/GitHub** 

 , SQL, and writing tests; curiosity about performance \\& a11y.
* Strong writing, growth mindset, and crisp async communication in a remote setup.



  





**Nice to have** 



* Projects or internships in
 
**fintech/wealth** 

 , charts/data‚Äëviz,
 
**Tailwind/shadcn** 

 , or
 
**Docker** 

 basics.
* Interest in markets (you‚Äôve tried paper trading) or product craft (you read
 
**WIRED** 

 or design/eng books).



  





**Extra credit ‚Äî tiny book club** 



* A chapter that stuck with you from
 
**Refactoring** 

 or
 
**The Pragmatic Programmer** 

 ‚Äîand how you used it.
* One idea you tried from
 
**Analysis Patterns** 

 (or similar) on a school project.

* Mathematics fundamentals: linear algebra, calculus, probability
* Interest in reading academic papers and trying to implement state\\-of\\-the\\-art experimental systems
* Experience using deep learning architectures
* Experience deploying highly scalable software supporting millions or more users
* Experience with GPU acceleration (i.e. CUDA and cuDNN)
* Experience with integrating applications and platforms with cloud technologies (i.e. AWS and GCP)
* Minimum experience of at least 5 years on relevant technologies

* Partner with data scientists to understand, implement, refine and design machine learning and other algorithms.
* Run regular A/B tests, gather data, perform statistical analysis, draw conclusions on the impact of your models.
* Work cross functionally with product managers, data scientists and product engineers, and communicate results to peers and leaders.
* Explore new technology shifts in order to determine how they might connect with the customer benefits we wish to deliver.
